bibl.title: Despatch from Owen L. W. Smith to David J. Hill
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p: Index Bureau Dept of State Rec'd May 6 '99

No. 27 Consular Series.
Legation of the United States,
Monrovia Liberia;
April 6, 1899.

Owen L. W. Smith
To
Hon. David J. Hill,
Assistant Secretary of State,
Washington.
An import duty of 8 cts per pound on American tobacco.

No. 27. Consular Series.
Legation of the United States,
Monrovia Liberia,
April 6, 1899.

Hon. David J. Hill,
Assistant Secretary of State,
Washington.

In response to Circular letter of Jan. 17, 1899, Department of State, Washington, relative to "restrictions put upon the sale of American tobacco," and in reply to my dispatch of Feb'y 28, 1899, to Department of State, Monrovia, I have the honor to herewith transmit to you the intelligence, that I am this day in receipt of a dispatch from the Department of State, Monrovia, informing me that "no restriction are imposed
imposed upon the importation of that article save the payment of an import duty of eight cents per pound."

I have the honor to be
your obedient servant,
Owen L. W. Smith
